realtimeweb.businesssearch.json

Class JsonBusinessSearch

  • Object
    • realtimeweb.businesssearch.json.JsonBusinessSearch
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AbstractBusinessSearch

    public class JsonBusinessSearch
extends Object
implements AbstractBusinessSearch
    The JsonBusinessSearch class is used to connect to the Yelp service and retrieve data JSON formatted data. All data is returned asynchronously - your program will continue to run while the data is being fetched, and the result will be sent to a callback function that you specify.

    There will only be one instance of the StructuredBusinessSearch, because it follows the Singleton pattern. In order to use it, first get the instance of the class. 
     StructuredBusinessSearch sbs = StructuredBusinessSearch.getInstance();
    Then you can either connect to the online service: 
     sbs.connect("key", "secret", "token", "secrettoken");
    or use the service offline: 
     sbs.setLocal();
    Author:
    acbart

    • Method Detail

      • setStoring

        public void setStoring(boolean storing)
        This method is for internal use only.

        When the system is storing, any requests made to the online Yelp service will be stored for future use. However, those requests will not be saved between runs of your program.

      • connect

        public void connect(String consumerKey,
           String consumerSecret,
           String token,
           String tokenSecret)
        Establishes a connection to the online Business Search service. dataservice. This does not require an internet connection. Requires registration information from Yelp. To get your key go to http://www.yelp.com/developers
        Specified by:
        connect in interface AbstractBusinessSearch

      • disconnect

        public void disconnect()
        Establishes that data should be retrieved locally instead of from the online service. This is the default behavior for the BusinessSearch.

        If data is being retrieved locally, you must be sure that your parameters match locally stored data. Otherwise, you will get nothing in return.
        Specified by:
        disconnect in interface AbstractBusinessSearch
        Parameters:
        local -

      • getBusinessData

        public void getBusinessData(String businessId,
                   JsonBusinessDataListener listener)
        Returns data about a business given its businessId (which is a sequence of characters, symbols, and numbers, e.g. "I_7cQmHxx6LokP9yr7Fx-w").
        Parameters:
        businessId - A string identifying the business.
        listener - a callback function that will consume the data (or error) about the business.

      • searchBusinesses

        public void searchBusinesses(BusinessQuery query,
                    JsonBusinessSearchListener listener)
        Queries the Yelp service for businesses that match the given BusinessQuery. Returns the data (or error) through the listener object.
        Parameters:
        query - A BusinessQuery object
        listener - A listener object that should contain methods for handling the data and, optionally, any errors.
